alert.note: Alert for St. Helena (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 8:20AM CDT until August 27 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tickfaw River at Liverpool affecting St. Helena Parish. For the Tickfaw River...including Liverpool...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tickfaw River at Liverpool. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Low lying roads and buildings near the river along with pasture and crop land will flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 AM CDT Wednesday was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.2 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.2 feet on 12/07/1971. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
